stories.text: The HN homepage has about four ranks colored black rather than gray. Currently this is "Learning how to ride a bike", "Log4j: Between a rock and a hard place", "How to train your decision-making AIs", "Carolina Gold was once the most popular rice grown in America (2019)", and "Packaging for instant coffee made out of seaweed". It seems to follow the story, e.g. the first one was #12 before and now it's #13, and the numbers 12 and now 13 were colored darker. They do not have in common a recent/old submission time, high/low score, or high/low comments.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why are a few rank numbers black on the homepage?

stories.text:
What specifically makes western women hate men so much?

My research on this topic indicates a statistically significant difference between women from the western world, compared to women in non-western countries.
stories.title: Ask HN: Why do Western Women hate men?
